reviews.review: 10/10 Picked up the can, saved the environment, got on a boat, then a buggy, then big jail boom, then bigger tower boom, all with lots of pew pew along the way.
This game compared to newer games shows how little of progress video game developers have made, or how ahead of its time this game was.
This is the best single player game I have played so far - by a lot. I've played through it four times, and I'd gladdly do it again. Well worth the money.
Nominated for "The Most Needed Sequel" Award
probably the best game on Steam just above the portal series if you haven't played this game at all your missing out
best game you ill ever play, so many years behind it and still so enjoyable

Half-Life 2 is one of a kind game. When I first tried it already was 5 years old. One can write a lot of facts about this games pros and cons. But for me the one thing that stands out after all the time is that this game still feels monumental mainly because of it's pacing and incredible art design. Of course as a story driven game it lacks any reason to play it multiple times (especially for the fact that this game is extremely scripted). But given it's price on sale there's pretty much no reason to try it. And if you can accept this game for what it is you might find very rewarding experience. 

Just one note would be that for me this game has some nostalgia, which mainly marks the gap between old games and modern ones. And this game falls on the later category. I have tried to play such games like Duke Nukem 3D and it felt too old for me, but this one still feels modern. As in general I don't like difficult games and always more attracted to casual games this might be the reason why I still like this game so much. Because of that I completely understand players who find this game to be bland, because from gameplay perspective (especialy after all sandbox addaptive AI trends) it is very shallow.
